summary: The document is a confidential CIA report from September 17, 1962, detailing the Royal Cambodian Government's (RKG) intention to sever diplomatic relations with South Vietnam. This decision was to be formalized in a cabinet meeting scheduled for September 19 or 20, 1962. The report, part of the National Security Files, is associated with the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992 and was classified as CONFIDENTIAL with dissemination controls.
key_findings: The Royal Cambodian Government planned to sever diplomatic relations with South Vietnam.
The decision was to be formalized in a cabinet meeting on September 19 or 20, 1962.
The report was classified as CONFIDENTIAL and included dissemination controls.
It is part of the National Security Files, specifically related to Vietnam in September 1962.
